text.p: There are 200,000 homeless people in France with millions more living in precarious conditions or with relatives because they are unable to find or afford their own lodgings, according to a report published on Thursday.
The annual report of the Abbe Pierre charity foundation said 470,000 people lived in makeshift accommodation, 1.5 million in sub-standard housing and 2.8 million with family or friends.
The report said the government could begin to tackle the problem by building between 320,000 and 350,000 flats a year but the figure of new flats in 1996 was 277,000.
The population of metropolitan France is 58 million.
